channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: Hamas rejects UN Gaza resolution
item.description: Hamas rejected the United Nations Security Council passing a US-drafted resolution endorsing US President Donald Trump's Gaza plan, saying it fails to meet Palestinians' rights and demands and seeks to impose an international trusteeship on the enclave that Palestinians and resistance factions oppo

item.title: Russian missile strike kills three, wounds 10 in Kharkiv region, Ukraine says
item.description: A Russian missile strike on the eastern Ukrainian city of Balakliia killed three people, with three teenagers among the 10 wounded, Kharkiv regional officials said on Monday. The overnight attack damaged multi-storey residence blocks and destroyed scores of cars in the city centre, Oleh Synehubov,

item.title: Britain’s BBC ‘determined to fight’ any Trump case, chair tells staff
item.description: Britain’s BBC is “determined to fight” any legal action filed by US President Donald Trump, saying on Monday there was no basis for a defamation case over its editing of one of his speeches. Trump said on Friday he would likely sue the BBC this week for as much as $5 billion afte

item.title: Russia adds ex-PM Kasyanov, economist Guriev to ‘extremists and terrorists’ list
item.description: Russia’s financial watchdog has added former prime minister Mikhail Kasyanov and leading economist Sergei Guriev to its list of “extremists and terrorists” in its latest moves against prominent exiled critics of the Kremlin. The watchdog, Rosfinmonitoring, added the two men to a

item.title: Trump says Cambodia, Thailand going to be fine after calls over conflict
President Trump signs government funding bill, ending shutdown after a record 43-day disruption
Trump says no US government official will attend G20 summit in South Africa
US judge rules Trump illegally ordered National Guard to Portland, Oregon
Iranian plot to kill Israel's ambassador to Mexico contained, US official says
Mamdani to Trump: 'Turn the volume up'
Trump tells Ilhan Omar to leave US
Fire at Mexico store kills at least 23
Trump sets refugee ceiling at record-low 7,500 with focus on white South Africans
Taiwan does not want China's 'one country, two systems', president says
Hurricane Melissa death toll climbs to 44
Protests erupt after police raid in Brazil leaves 119 dead
Two dead, 18 hurt in South Korea after truck crashes into market, media reports say
item.description: A light truck crashed into a market in South Korea on Thursday, ploughing 150 metres (164 yards) along a passageway lined with stalls before coming to a halt, killing two people and injuring 18, according to emergency officials and media reports. The incident took place at a market located in Buch

item.title: Australian state signs country's first treaty with Indigenous people into law
item.description: The Australian state of Victoria on Thursday signed into law the country’s first treaty with Indigenous people, hailed by advocates as a major step towards reconciliation by giving first inhabitants more oversight on decisions that concern them. The treaty, which will take effect on Dec 12,

item.title: Afghanistan economic recovery buckles as nine in 10 families go hungry or into debt, UNDP says
item.description: Afghanistan's economic recovery is buckling as nine in 10 households are forced to skip meals, sell belongings or take on debt to survive, the United Nations said on Wednesday, warning that mass returns are exacerbating the country's worst crisis since the Taliban returned to power. A United Natio

item.title: Pakistan blames India after suicide bomber kills 12 in Islamabad
item.description: Pakistan has accused India of orchestrating a deadly suicide blast that killed at least 12 people and injured more than 30 outside a district court in Islamabad on Tuesday, intensifying regional tensions as officials also pointed fingers at Afghan-based militants. According to Interior Minister Mo

item.title: India's Modi vows not to spare those behind Delhi car blast
item.description: Indian police are investigating a deadly car blast in the capital under a law used to fight "terrorism", an officer said on Tuesday, as Prime Minister Narendra Modi vowed to bring to justice all those responsible. The explosion near the historic Red Fort on Monday evening killed at least eight peo

item.title: Pakistan's army chief to get expanded powers under proposed reform
item.description: Pakistan's powerful army chief will be given an expanded role and the remit of the Supreme Court will be curbed under constitutional changes passed by the upper house of parliament on Monday, a move the opposition says will undermine democracy. Pakistan, historically coup-prone, is seeing its long

item.title: Indonesia grants national hero status to late strongman President Suharto
item.description: Indonesia awarded the title of national hero on Monday to late President Suharto, who was forced out of office in 1998 by violent protests that ended a three-decade rule marred by accusations of mass human rights violations, corruption and nepotism. The title was conferred in a ceremony presided o

item.title: Pakistan approves bill to expand army chief’s powers amid broad constitutional changes
item.description: Pakistan’s parliament has taken a significant step towards expanding the constitutional powers of its military leadership, as the standing committees on law and justice of both houses approved the draft of a bill for the 27th Constitutional Amendment, reports bdnews24.com, citing Dawn. Senat

item.title: 1 dead, 10 rescued after migrant boat capsizes off Malaysia-Thailand waters
item.description: At least one individual has been found dead and 10 others have been rescued after a boat carrying nearly 100 undocumented migrants sank in waters near the Malaysia-Thailand maritime border, Malaysia's national news agency Bernama quoted local police as saying on Sunday. Malaysia's Kedah police chi

item.title: Hundreds missing after migrant vessel sinks off Malaysia-Thailand border
item.description: Hundreds were missing on Sunday after a boat sank near the Thailand-Malaysia border, as 10 survivors and one body were recovered, the Malaysian maritime authority said. More victims might still be found at sea some three days after the sinking of the vessel, which left Buthidaung, Myanmar, with ab

item.title: Gaza death toll surpasses 69,000
item.description: Health officials in Gaza said Saturday that more than 69,000 Palestinians have been killed since the start of the Israel-Hamas war, as both sides continued exchanging bodies under a shaky ceasefire agreement. The increase in casualties comes as additional bodies are recovered from the rubble acros

item.title: Afghanistan, Pakistan peace talks collapse, ceasefire continues
item.description: Peace negotiations between Afghanistan and Pakistan broke down, although a ceasefire continues between the South Asian neighbours, a Taliban spokesperson said on Saturday. Zabihullah Mujahid said negotiations had failed due to Islamabad insisting that Afghanistan assume responsibility for Pakistan
